text: <@U2N8XTX0R|mucahitsidimi> has joined the channel
<@U2N2ZG938> check your import statements, you probably import R from the package `android` while you have to use the package of your app.
hi guys, is there any feasible way to deal with audio things on android, such as mixing, effect, convert,...
i've tried media codec but it isnt flexible, some native lib do the job very good, but still crash on some devices
i've read about opensl es, but wonder if the usability worths the learning curve
:confused:
hi, does anybody here have experiences with "1 Activity - Multiple Fragment" architecture ?
do you like it ?
I was using it. It's OK :slightly_smiling_face:
In my opinion, I like it
you can control the flow easily
and in activity, you can consider it as a God Object and do anything in it
save data, run asynctask, vvv..v
but does this approach have any disadvantage ?
AsyncTask OMG
God Object is your problem
just want to know everybody' opinion and experience
<@U0ESBF4AV> what's problem with it ?
In my opinion, every class should have their main objective
and God object violate it
<@U291N02SH> one disadvantage for me is that it does not force you to write your app in a modular way
could you plz describe the problem in more detail ?
One word: SOLID
Your classes should be loose couples and shouldn't depend on God object or something.
I think ndusart and miha explained it well
I know about solid, Logic of screen will be control in fragment
I think you should try to read clean code my Robert C. Martin
activity will control the flow
how the flow is harder to control in multiple activities than in multiple fragments architecture ?

By the way, it's okay to control multiple fragments which are parts of one flow inside of Activity.
For example, series of questions that help user fill his profile.
Yes, the two ways can be used in the same app.

<@U1H4F3ZCH> : you have to specify launch mode. Then android system will control the backstack for you. In some case, the flow is complex.
If you use activity to control, you can decide yourself
That's only two ways of "deciding yourself"
Handling all logic inside of a single class is bad practice, and makes your code much hard to maintain. Each class should have a single purpose and not have cross purposes attached
>makes your code much hard to maintain
this is the key
It's beer o'clock here so I need to go, have a nice discussion! see you guys tomorrow! :beers: :sake:
Project I’m on atm had an abstract BaseActivity with ~1700 lines of code… We spent about a week pulling it apart into separate classes with individual purposes and got it down to ~40 lines
Those lines were literally just setting up the toolbar
No, logic still in fragment, Activity just control flow and some task that use throughout the app.
Because lazy
I treat Activities/Fragments as if they’re view atm, following MVP

<@U291N02SH> we aren't saying you cannot write loosely coupled classes with multiple fragments, it's just that this architecture will push you to as it will probably be faster/easier for some code to do it that way.
<@U1LJG0Y03> : aren't they more the presenter part ?
Depends on your interpretation
All my activities/fragments do is manipulate views
They ask the presenter for data, and the presenter calls methods on the view
`button.setOnClickListener(view -> presenter.getData());`
In the activity
no, they aren’t in any way a presenter part
they’re a view
actually a viewcontroller
I’ve seen maybe 1 time they’re used as presenter, and it looked horrible to work with :stuck_out_tongue:
err viewcontroller is not what I call the view part
I don’t use MVC but if it’s anything by design it’s kind of a viewcontroller
but in MVP it should be treated like a view
so in MVP, the view can say "execute this function if this button is clicked" ?
Nope
The view can ask the presenter to do something
The presenter then goes and does what it needs to do, and then asks the view to show/hide/do something visually
<@U2N9W4U6A|pesp> has joined the channel

ok, I agree, it's good practice to give presenter role to another class, but then I do not see why the Activity is no way a presenter, but definitely a controller in MVC pattern, it's a developer choice, and if you don't want it to be a presenter (for good reasons), you wouldn't want it to be a controller either.

I am working on a discussion like structure (post, comments etc), the posts and comments will be json on some urls, so how should i go about this, for displaying in recycler view. Should i generate post and comments on saperate urls and get them individually by making request call or in one url i fetch all the data..

Hi everyone, I have a question.
I have a fragment (FragA) and two activity (ActB , ActC)
Im using this fragment in both activity, I need to call a method from activity, How can I learn which activity is using FragA.
I would actually use something like event bus / Rx publish subject to broadcast the event. And handle the broadcast differently in different activities?
@resp thanks for answe, but in this project we are not using Rx or event bus, I need to find fundamental ways
<@U2N8XTX0R>  define an interface (like FragAListener) that your activities will implement, add a function to register the listener and call the function of that interface.
You can also use local broadcasts.

lol! :slightly_smiling_face:
if (getActivity() instanceof ActB){}
thanks everone :slightly_smiling_face:
<@U2N8XTX0R> : avoid circular dependencies if possible :wink:
<@U1H4F3ZCH> you right, but its not possible in this app, thanks :slightly_smiling_face:
err, we just gave you some solutions requiring no thirdparty library...
it's totally possible

But you’ll be able to see individual dependencies though

So it could at least give you an idea

so the default will only be applied to those below hdpi, basically ldpi, mdpi.. correct?
Yes

text:
It basically uses a `ForegroundColorSpan` and applies that to one character at a time in a `String` and continuously loops through.
The troubling I'm having with this is the `Textview` width changes based on which letter is currently having the `ForegroundColorSpan` applied to it
